criteria: Understanding of Mean and Standard Deviation
Fitting Data to a Normal Distribution
descriptions: No understanding of mean or standard deviation is demonstrated.
Demonstrates minimal understanding of mean or standard deviation.
Demonstrates a basic understanding of mean and standard deviation but struggles with application.
Demonstrates a clear understanding of mean and standard deviation and can apply them to simple data sets.
Demonstrates a strong understanding of mean and standard deviation and can apply them to a variety of data sets.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of mean and standard deviation and can explain their significance in detail.
Unable to fit data to a normal distribution.
Attempts to fit data to a normal distribution but is unsuccessful.
Fits data to a normal distribution with significant errors.
Fits data to a normal distribution with minor errors.
Accurately fits data to a normal distribution.
Accurately fits data to a normal distribution and can explain the process.
Unable to estimate population percentages using the normal distribution.
Attempts to estimate population percentages but is unsuccessful.
Estimates population percentages with significant errors.
Estimates population percentages with minor errors.
Accurately estimates population percentages.
Accurately estimates population percentages and can justify the reasoning.
Does not recognize when the normal distribution is inappropriate.
Recognizes that the normal distribution is not always appropriate but cannot explain why.
Identifies some situations where the normal distribution is inappropriate but misses others.
Generally identifies when the normal distribution is appropriate but may have some confusion.
Consistently identifies when the normal distribution is appropriate and provides clear explanations.
Demonstrates a deep understanding of the limitations of the normal distribution and can explain complex scenarios.
Unable to use calculators, spreadsheets, or tables to estimate areas under the normal curve.
Struggles to use calculators, spreadsheets, or tables to estimate areas under the normal curve.
Uses technology with significant errors or inefficiencies.
Uses technology effectively but may need some guidance.
Uses technology efficiently and accurately.
Demonstrates mastery of technology and can teach others how to use it.
